column5: Can't speak to the accuracyâ€¦ but here are 11 maps that might make you look at things differently.  http://www.awesome-fun.com/11-cool-maps-didnt-teach-school/

In the schools up to the 1960's, pink on the map represented the extent of the British Empire/Commonwealth, and that covered nearly a third of the global map. By extension, it is only normal to get into conflicts with your neighbours. Or in the case of map #1, 90% of the non British World.

Definitely the best one:  http://www.awesome-fun.com/11-cool-maps-didnt-teach-school/nggallery/image/world-map-of-penis-size/  Nice to see Canada top the US. Just like in hockey. You're welcome, ladies.
